channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish left everywhere, 25th June
item.description:
The binmen came this morning and have left the place a state there's rubbish everywhere and this keeps happening. They also regularly leave the bins locked , the broken lid has been left there for so long I remember seeing snow on it last winter, just remove it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bush Road, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 26 Harvist Road, 25th June
item.description:
The refuse collection today didn’t pick up our recycling We are religious about ensuring we only include items for recycling When I attempted to report a missed collection it wouldn’t allow me the option to do this. Pls collect by tomorrow.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Harvist Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Permanent rubbish … never clean street, 25th June
item.description:

item.title: In yellow box Junction of Bloomsbury way and Southampton Row northbound, 25th June
item.description:
Multiple potholes on Southampton Row yellow box Junction northbound on sainsburys local side and they are getting deeper and spraying stones everywhere
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southampton Row, Holborn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 25th June
item.description:
Abandoned vehicle SUZUKI GRAND VITARA Parked on grass verge Vehicle has been left for over 1 month and now has a broken window This needs to be attended to before it gets burnt out
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Juniper Close, Broxbourne
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress and rubbish dumped, 25th June
item.description:
I reported the mattress 2 days ago and you said it had been collected. It has not. Also some rubbish has also been dumped now too. It’s constant and non stop with rubbish and crap being dumped. There are also 2 wheelie bins dumped on the opposite side of the road with no lids full of rubbish. The people in this road are dirty lazy people who do not care about where they live. You need to put signs or cameras up as this is constant. Every day I arrive home from work to something else!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Halcot Avenue, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes on the Millennium way, 25th June
item.description:
For the past 5 years i have been complaining on the potholes in North Greenwich Station and Millennium Way and no action to date The road by the roundabout is been having a pothole that no body seems to care

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Millennium Way, Greenwich Peninsula, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bromley thinks this is fixed!, 25th June
item.description:
Bromley has allegedly written to the persons in this thread and closed the report. The Pond is NOT fixed. This is fix-my-street, not 'oh I'll write another memo ' or even worse engage a consultant!. Bromley speak to and support those that want to help. Speak to the Bromley Civic Society

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tetty Way, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken sunken, 25th June
item.description:
Several badly damaged and slightly sunken paving slabs next to parking bay by 64 Axminster Crescent. Could pose tripping hazard for children and people with pushchairs. Problem noticed around 2 weeks ago, maybe longer

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Axminster Crescent, East Wickham, London

item.title: Dumped fridge, 25th June
item.description:
